snippet: In a contentious hearing, an official from the Department of Veterans Affairs’ watchdog agency confirmed for the first time that delays in care may have contributed to patients’ deaths.
abstract: Acting Department of Veterans Affairs inspector general Richard J Griffin, in contentious hearing before Congress, acknowledges for first time that delays in care had contributed to deaths of patients at department's medical center in Phoenix.
lead_paragraph: In a contentious hearing, an official from the Department of Veterans Affairs’ watchdog agency confirmed for the first time that delays in care may have contributed to patients’ deaths.

headline.main: V.A. Official Acknowledges Link Between Delays and Patient Deaths
headline.print_headline: V.A. Official Acknowledges Link Between Delays and Patient Deaths
